headline: Butternut Squash Soup
description: This easy butternut squash soup with potatoes, carrots, celery, and onion cooks up quickly into a thick, velvety soup that's ready in about 1 hour.

video.name: How to Make Butternut Squash Soup

name: Butternut Squash Soup
recipeIngredient: 1 medium butternut squash - peeled, seeded, and cubed
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat, and cook onion, celery, carrot, potatoes, and squash until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Pour in enough of the chicken stock to cover vegetables.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low, cover pot, and simmer until all vegetables are tender, about 40 minutes.
Transfer the soup to a blender, and blend until smooth. Return to the pot, and mix in any remaining stock to reach desired consistency. Season with salt and pepper.

review.reviewBody: Great starter recipe. Read other comments and reviews so I added a pinch of rubbed sage and a pinch of rosemary, a little Salt and pepper, cup of white wine and a cup of heavy cream. To make it keto I used a small head of cauliflower instead of the potatoes. Followed the cooking method exactly. Came out great. Served in bowls with a dollop of sour cream sprinkled with chives. Everyone loved it! Thanks for a great, fun and easy soup recipe to make!!
I have made this several times. I upped the flavor by adding coriander and a little thyme. Super fast ro make!
Great recipe! Will definitely make it again :)

I thought this recipe was very good. I did combine it with another because I wanted to add more complexity to my soup. I added: 1 large yellow onion, chopped ½ teaspoon sea salt 3 garlic cloves, chopped 1 tablespoon chopped fresh sage ½ tablespoon minced fresh rosemary 1 teaspoon grated ginger And Chopped parsley at the end after blending all the soup together. I also deglazed with one cup of white wine after sautéing all my ingredients before adding chicken stock. It came out very good, definitely recommend.

Very flavorful. Really delicious. I followed the recipe but added just one potato for every squash. Added some curry, cayenne and fresh rosemary. The flavors really complimented each other. It's so easy!!
This soup was absolutely delicious. The only thing that I would do differently is Add an apple to the pot to Sweden it a biit....
THE BOMB!

Excellent and easy recipe! I always have to throw in my own creativity, so I added a bit of spring onion greens and thyme, and only blended 3/4 of the veggies after cooking. My wife loved it! I’ll make this again.
I just added more spices as to our liking and added a can of coconut milk it came out great no butter but oil. Nice and creamy and thick everyone loves it
Wonderful!! I added a dash of celery seed.

I added home made turkey broth, applesauce, my home grown sage, and used an emulsion blender with a chopping blade on it and made it super smooth! As a garnish, I put cubes of feta in olive oil as a garnish!
I followed the recipe exactly and it turned out perfectly. 10/10 recommend this!
It was easy to make. I did include a clove of garlic and when seasoning, I only added salt, ground pepper, a little nutmeg, and cinnamon. Delicious! I'll make it again.

We have been struggling to find a butternut squash recipe that we liked since being gifted with these squash from friends' gardens. This is hands-down our favorite! I did use about 1/3-1/2 of our squash for another recipe, so we didn't use a full squash for this recipe, but it was so good! It tasted very savory and potatoe-y, which we really liked.
It was so good. My husband and I loved it.
I made this soup this afternoon - a simple wholesome recipe and easy to make - perfect for a Winter Saturday lunch.

This is a great recipe!! I did follow the recipe but made a couple of errors along the way that still made it great! I chunked the 3 lb squash into 1" cubes, I didn't have any potatoes, I used 1/2 sweet onion, chopped fine, 2 stalks of Celery chopped fine, 1 medium Carrot chopped fine, 64 oz of low sodium Chicken broth to cover all of the squash and veggies, a healthy dose of Italian Spices, and boiled @ med heat for 1 Hr, (because I fell asleep). Removed it from the heat, Mashed everything with a potato masher, added 16 Oz of whipping cream, 1/2 block of Philadelphia, and 2 generous scoops of sour cream, and Sea salt and course pepper to taste. Mixed all of that together, and let cool overnight. Tonight, Soup was awesome when reheated.
Very good ! I used vegetable broth . Flavorful. I’ll definitely make this soup recipe again.
I put Vegetable Stock in it instead of Chicken Stock....
The potatoes destroyed the soup. Lost all the squash flavor. Soup prepared as written is very bland. I’ve doubled the squash and still can’t overcome the potato flavor. So disappointing.
I love this recipe and so does my granddaughter. I have shared it with her other grandmother and her dad and everyone makes it for her
We thought it was delicious. We used squash, garlic and potato from our garden. We don't have a food processor so I used a hand masher. Lotachopping!
This is a winner! I added some garlic cloves and a tsp of curry, couldn’t get enough!
This is my go to recipe for squash soup. Love it. I add garlic and a bit more broth.
Great recipe, I’ve made it several times. I also added a minced clove of garlic to the recipe. Delicious recipe!
I've made this soup so many times and tried different ingredients to it. It has not failed me yet. Love it, love it.

perfect beginner recipe! i advise to make as shown first, and then as you make it another time add in things like a small apple (cook with the onion, squash. etc), a bit of cinnamon and nutmeg (teaspoon or as to liking) I slowly add spices as it cooks until the flavor is to liking. pro tip! roast squash (and pumpkin if you like) beforehand in the oven and then add to simmer step. it helps the individual flavor of the onion and celery shine when you're sauteeing.. image shown is before blending
Added 1 cup half and half, nutmeg, 1 apple (cored and diced) and a couple sprigs of rosemary. Used immersion blender, perfect!
Very delicious soup that tastes great
I love this soup! I used parsnips instead of potatoes and it is creamy and fabulous! I also added a bit of smoked paprika and a tiny piece of jalapeño for a little heat. Delicious 😋
This recipe was fantastic! It was very easy to make and tasted superb! It's a beautiful colour and so delicious!
Added an apple and cinnamon, topped with nutmeg and a little Greek yogurt. The yogurt was not needed.

Super easy, can customize, only one pot required. I made it as-is. So good! I added a bit more water after pure to get the perfect consistency. You could add apple and or more carrot, whatever is in the fridge! My second go at it I threw in two apples, one potato only, maple syrup and brown sugar. This is a basic recipe that's good for learning cooks. You can customize it and build from there. Mmmm! P.s. this soup is HOT as it simmers. Watch out. I spilled it on my hand and had a blister bigger than a golf ball. I've got a huge scar now :( Wear mitts with soup!

Per other reviewers, I added a granny smith and 1 cup of cream. (It tasted fine before adding the cream, but adding it made it even better.) I am NOT a fan of baked squash. While there was a hint of that flavor, it had none of the nastiness that mushy baked squash has. The other flavors (celery, potatoes,...) helped mellow it out.
Delish!
Made it just as recipe stated and REALLY liked it. If you really like spice, you'll need to add to it.
Easy and delicious. I read a lot of the reviews and tried the following suggestions. Used sweet potato and 1 apple. Used a little cream. Added a fresh sprig of rosemary. Fall in a bowl.

I followed the basics, I also put in my own twist by adding all spice, clove and cinnamon. It gives it much more flavour, to some I don’t add the evaporated milk as I have one that is lactose intolerant. We top ours with yogurt, for those that can have it and sprinkle some nutmeg. I don’t use any potatoes. I get in trouble if I don’t make this at least 2x a year lol This year I’m going to add apple!
So simple and delicious. Husband topped with bacon bits and loved it too.

This is a decent base but I made several changes based on comments of previous makers which made it much more flavorful than I believe it would have been: -Added one apple -Added about 3/4c pumpkin purée -Substituted sweet potato -Used vegetable broth instead of chicken -Added rosemary (I love butternut squash with rosemary) -Added heavy cream It was fantastic especially for my first time making this soup, but it still needed a bit more spice in my opinion. If there wasn’t apple or rosemary added, this recipe would have had an incredibly bland flavor.

It’sa good base recipe but I used some of the other suggestions. I used a Dutch oven and sautéed the butternut squash in there for 10 minutes in some butter. Once it was almost done I used a pan and sautéed the carrots, celery, onion and a peeled diced apple. I also used a sweet potato. I used vegetable broth as well and a little bit of home made chicken broth. I used an immersion blender.
First time making this recipe and it turned out wonderfully. It’s delicious and will definitely be making again!
Great for fall . especially good red pepper flakes
It was so easy to make and delicious! I substituted sweet potatoes in place of the regular potatoes ! So good!

This is not "tons of flavor". Additionally, the ingredient list is incorrect. It is a RIB of celery, not a STALK of celery. If you follow this recipe to the T, it is extremely underwhelming. This is not for new cooks because we cannot improvise on the fly.
Family loved it - I made with leftover beef broth and added spinach instead of celery. The color was a little “odd” but it tasted great! My picky son even liked it when I said it was squash!
I made this recipe exactly as is except that I added a pinch of garlic powder and 1/3 cup of orange juice cause I just felt it needed some acid. Turned out amazing, surprised myself
Good flavour, easy making and minimal ingredients

Great recipe! I did a bit of a change up by roasting the butternut squash first with nutmeg, olive oil, and ginger. I also changed the chicken stock for vegetable broth, and added a little bit of curry powder to spice it up. I did add a bit of whipping cream. After reading this, it looks like I completely dismantled the recipe but the basics of it worked for me; I just made a few changes to suit my taste. A must try recipe.

It’s not done yet but I can tell this is gonna be fantastic. I substituted sweet potatoes for regular potatoes, added a couple teaspoons of minced garlic, and about a cup and a half of chunky applesauce to a doubled recipe of the soup. Even before the vegetables are cooked, the broth has incredibly nice flavor. I’m using two butternut squash freshly picked from the garden. … and now it’s done and the flavor is amazing. The applesauce adds just a bit of sweet brightness. Tips on peeling the squash were helpful. Pierce the skin and microwave for 2 minutes, and peeling with a vegetable peeler is pretty easy.
This soup was absolutely delicious. Thick, creamy and topped with crumbled bacon, just perfect.

Easy, heathy, and delicious. Topped with fresh grated parmesan and home made croutons. Plan for the first step of cooking to take longer than 5 minutes, however. I didn’t time it, but it takes much longer than 5 minutes to brown the veggies.

I love this recipe because it’s simple and a great base but having made it over the years there’s a few things to consider. If you like a sweeter soup, roast the squash (425F for 50 min cut in half). Browned butter gives this a great flavour - I browned butter with ginger and garlic then added veggies and you end up with more flavour to season. Coconut milk, sage butter, curry, cinnamon - you can add whatever and this is going to change the flavour to your liking. Last up a blender purées the best so if you can transfer it in batches it’s worth it for silky smooth soup. If using celery, cook it with butter ahead and chop finely.
I had never had butternut squash soup before. This was a great recipe, and so easy.
Very easy to make very tasty .

Wonderful flavor and consistency. I used granny smith apple rather than potato. After blending it, I added some garlic seasoning, sage, rosemary, cumin, ginger, salt, white pepper, 2/3C whole milk, bacon bits and a little italian sausage with some chopped swiss chard leaf. My wife doesn't usually like squash soup but likes this.

Fabulous soup, great for a fall or winter dinner! As some of the other reviews suggested, added a sweet potato and apple, along with 1/2 tsp each of nutmeg and curry. Added 3 cloves of minced garlic to onion and celery mix and sauteed first. Then added carrot, squash and sweet potato mixture, sauteed for another 10 minutes before adding chicken stock. Added heavy cream after blending. Might be easier (and add extra flavor) if squash were to be roasted first. Also less chance of taking off a finger whilst paring the squash!

This was like heaven ! I added half a cube of chicken bouillon to the chicken broth/vegetable mixture and I slow roasted a whole garlic and then added it at the end. I sprinkled a bit of curry and voila! Superb!!
This is a delicious soup and no added sweetness so it eats like a meal and not a small side!
So good! I used sweet potatoes in place of white and added garlic . Topped it off with Parmesan cheese and parsley to look pretty!
Super easy and tasty! Glad we made it to warm us upon a cold afternoon!

This turned out wonderful! The only changes I made to recipe was switched out white potato for sweet potato and used vegetable broth in lieu of chicken broth. 
 Recommend draining and reserving stock before blending. Then add stock as need to achieve right consistency.
It was delicious, made enough to eat for a few days. Will definitely make it again.
This recipe is quick and easy! I make a this soup often now adding garlic and a little curry. I use sweet potatoes instead of regular potatoes and it is so delicious!
I made this soup and it was so delicious. My family and friends asked me to make it again. It's worth 5 stars.
Man, Oh, Man this is fantastic. I didn't change a thing. So good- I was even eating it cold (Shhhh...I couldn't wait for it to reheat).
I heeded the advice of other reviews and only used one potato instead of two. However, it STILL had an overwhelming potato taste. If I make it again, I will leave out potatoes completely. Still good.

So easy to do I actually cooked it in my instant pot! Saute function for the vegetables then once I added my liquid pressure cook for 30 minutes! Once done used an immersion blender for and it was amazing! Fast and easy.
This soup is so good. I pretty much followed the recipe as is, except added a bit more water and salt as it was too thick, and doubled the butter.

Made just as the recipe instructed. Great flavor. Mild enough for toddlers palate. Will be serving for Thanksgiving along appetizers. My question is can I make it ahead, freeze and defrost just before heating?
Butter nut fresh from my garden - absolutely superb! Surpasses any bought or restaurant quality. Thanks. Chris (man about the house)
OMG. This was great. Made it exactly as described except used 1/2 & 1/2 instead of whole cream. Made enough to freeze some. Will make it again.
Followed a lot of the recommendations of others who have made this soup. It was delicious!
I found it to be very bland, I added a touch of nutmeg and a splash of cinnamon, I had to add extra pepper also. Still tastes like its lacking something.
I had no idea what to do with the Butternut Squash. I found this recipe and followed the instructions and it was delicious.
I added a small amount of curry powder and smoked paprika, and served it with a dollop of sour cream
I just stick the squash in the pressure cooker, after cutting it in half. 12 min or so and then its very easy to scoop out the flesh.
So basic yet so delicious. I added bay leaves while it was simmering, and it didn't even need salt!

I have made this twice. I like how easy it is to make. One thing I noticed everyone says it's bland. I spice mine up with nutmeg, allspice. But my favorite add on would be the slice of goat cheese in the top. I add it while it's in my bowl because not everyone in my family likes it.

This is an amazing soup. Turned out way better than I expected it. Made way too much for just me, so I gave it to my neighbors and they absolutely loved it too! I will be making this for the holidays from now on...Is the perfect soup to have while dinner is making and so easy to make!
It was very creamy and smooth and very tasty. Make sure you use lower sodium chicken stock you won’t need to add any salt, very delicious and hearty!

Made this tonight and it was delicious! I used up a sweet potato I had plus one regular potato. Otherwise followed the recipe as written. I did sprinkle in a touch of curry powder at the end for taste. Love this recipe! Thanks!

This recipe was very good with everyone's suggested. I cheated and used frozen butternut squash two bags. I have made this recipe twice and is very delicious and easy. I never use the blender as I like to eat the vegetables diced up and I think it adds more flavor that way.
Very good and easy. Only had 1 potato, added extra carrots and celery (needed to be used), had one can of broth so used bullion and water to make the difference! Will do again!
I just added a few spices...red pepper flakes, a tiny bit of cinnamon, chili powder and garlic powder. It was fine without but i like everything a little spicy!
Used Kampuchea
Easy to make - I use sweet potatoes instead of white; add 1/4 c brown sugar and 1 tsp curry to bring out flavor

Absolutely loved this recipe! I did roast the entire squash in the oven. I did substitute sweet potato for regular potatoes. I added sage, cinnamon and nutmeg. It reminded me of Thanksgiving! Personally for me it’s like dessert! Yummy!
added cinnamon, minced garlic, fresh ginger

This is a great procedural base for a butternut pumpkin soup. The direction you take it from here is really I p to your palate. I add a dash of mild curry powder, a couple of bay leaves, paprika, nutmeg and cinnamon because I enjoy a spicier and more exciting soup. Some might like the bland version; personally I found it a bit boring the first time when I made it as it was written. I’ve made it several times since and have explored with various flavours. I’m quite pleased with the soup as it is with these minor tweaks and therefore feel 4 stars is justified :)

I made this soup as shown in the directions except. I added fresh garlic and sauteed it along with the onions I also seasoned the butternut squash with garlic powered, onion powered, salt, freshly crushed black pepper, and rosemary then I roasted the butternut squash for 35 minutes at 350 degrees. Do not have to roast the butternut squash but I had time so I did. The soup can out delicious with these flew changes both my kids and husband loved it. I am definitely making it again.
I made this recipe with some of the edits suggested and it turned out phenomenal!!

Yummy and substantial soup which was a hit with this household. After reading other reviews, I added 1/2 tsp curry powder as well as a bit of cinnamon & nutmeg. I didn't have sour cream so I added about a 1/2 cup of ricotta cheese I had on hand it it added a nice creaminess to it (use what you've got!). I will be making this again.

It was really tasty and ill definitely be making it again. I love how simple this recipe is. Pretty much just cut veggies, pour in broth, let sit, and then blend. 
I added a bit of chilli power, curry powder and parsley.

Liked the recipe, however, I did add several cloves of garlic, and I baked cubed butternut squash with salt, pepper, olive oil instead of butter in the oven and then added it to the pot. Puréed after veggies were tender. I added smoked paprika and hot pepper flakes to give it a slight kick. Very good.

I got a butternut squash in my veggie co-op so I decided to make this soup today. I had all of the other ingredients handy so it seemed serendipitous that I should make this recipe. As always, I read other reviews to see suggested modifications.

1) Veggies: I reduced the potatoes down to 1, as suggested by most. I didn't have any sweet potatoes on hand (which some have also recommended and sounds great) but the white potato I had on hand worked. Some people suggest to take out the celery because it is stringy but I think it lends flavor so I just chopped it finely to eliminate the issue.

2) Cooking - I followed the recipe pretty closely but did roast the squash first as it was too hard to cut. And I also used coconut oil to saute the veggies as I think it adds a nice sweetness to soups of this style.

3) Spices - Most people agree this needs some spices. I used what I had that seemed to be a good flavor fit - cinnamon (commonly recommended), garam marsala, cumin and cayenne. Just a dash of each. Then salt and pepper to taste.

That is it and it was delicious! I added sour cream to one serving and left it off the next. I could go either way.

I did roast the seeds too to sprinkle on top! Rinse, dry, mix with olive oil and salt. Roast on 400 for 30 minutes or until brown. Adds a nice texture and flavor sprinkled on top!
With some modifications, this recipe is perfect. My husband loved it!

I just tried squash itself for the very first time about 2 weeks ago. Never did I think I'd like it so much! After having it as a side, I knew I had to find a soup! This one was fantastic! I'm happy I read through a handful of the other reviews. 
Here's how I modified it: one potato (a medium sized red one) instead of two, added 1/4 tsp. cinnamon, a pinch of ginger, a pinch of nutmeg and 2 cloves of garlic. 
Many said curry would be good, and I intended to add that, except we had none! Next time that's the only thing I'd try to add. Otherwise, amazing how I made it! Yum!
Delish and easy !!!@
